original_title: There’s A New Reusable Rocket, And It’s A Honda
original_content:
As we watched the latest SpaceX Starship rocket test end in a spectacular explosion, we might have missed the news from Japan of a different rocket passing a successful test. We all know Honda as a car company but it seems they are in the rocket business too, and they successfully tested a reusable rocket. Its an experimental 900 kg model that flew to a height of 300 m before returning itself to the pad, but it serves as a valuable test platform for Hondas take on the technology.
Its a research project as it stands, but its being developed with an eye towards future low-cost satellite launches rather than as a crew launch platform.As a news story though its of interest beyond its technology, because its too easy to miss news from the other side of the world when all eyes are looking at Texas. Its the latest in a long line of interesting research projects from the company, and we hope that this time they resist the temptation to kill their creation rather than bring it to market.
title: - ホンダが成功させた再利用可能ロケット試験
body: ホンダが900kgの再利用可能ロケットを成功裏に試験し、低コストの衛星打ち上げに向けた研究を進めている。
titles: - ホンダが成功させた再利用可能ロケット試験
- 最新のスペースXに隠れた日本のロケット成功試験
- ホンダの900kg実験ロケット、300mの飛行に成功
- 未来の低コスト衛星打ち上げを見据えたホンダの取り組み
- 世界の注目を集めるホンダの宇宙研究プロジェクト
